member.name: T:XcoAppSpaces.Contracts.CcrDispatching.ICcrDispatcherService
member.summary: Service that gives access to the Ccr Dispatcher and DispatcherQueue of an appspace instance. The service can be used by other services of the space to get access to the space's Dispatcher and DispatcherQueue. To provide the possiblity of having seperated processing of normal worker tasks and appspace-internal tasks (like sending messages or resolving workers) two different dispatcher queues are available.

member.summary: Checks a certain address if it is the address of the local space. This is the case if the address is either NULL of if it is equal (ignoring case) to the local address.
member.returns: True if the address refers to the local space.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Contracts.Communication.IConnector.ConnectWorker``1(System.String,System.String,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to a worker that is running at a remote space. Returns information that can be used to generate proxy of the worker that allows posting messages that are automatically transported to the worker. If the worker does't exist or the connection to the space cannot be established, an XcoCommunicationException is thrown.
member.typeparam: The contract type of the worker to connect to.
member.param: The address of the worker in den form "address/workername"
The name of the communication service that should be used to communicate with the worker (or null if the default communication service should be used).
The credentials that should be used to connect to the worker.
member.returns: Information about the worker that can be used to generate a proxy to communicate with this worker.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Contracts.Communication.IConnector.ConnectWorker``1(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to a worker that is running at a remote space. Returns information that can be used to generate proxy of the worker that allows posting messages that are automatically transported to the worker. If the worker does't exist or the connection to the space cannot be established, an XcoCommunicationException is thrown.
member.typeparam: The contract type of the worker to connect to.
member.param: The address of the space where the worker is running (in form hostname:port).
The name of the communication service that should be used to communicate with the worker (or null if the default communication service should be used).
The credentials that should be used to connect to the worker.
member.returns: Information about the worker that can be used to generate a proxy to communicate with this worker.

member.summary: Messages are transferred sequentially. This guarantees that the messages arrive exactly in the order in which they were posted.

member.summary: Base class for the attributes to mark processor methods for ccr processing.

member.name: P:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoProcessorAttribute.MessageTransferMode
member.summary: The mode in which messages coming from remote spaces are transferred for this worker port.

member.name: T:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoConcurrentAttribute
member.summary: Marks a Method of a Worker for processing objects of a certain type that are posted to the worker concurrently. (Method and fitting port of the worker are added to a CCR ConcurrentReceiverGroup.) MessageTransferMode is "Parallel" by default.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoConcurrentAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new XcoConcurrentAttribute.

member.name: T:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoExclusiveAttribute
member.summary: Marks a Method of a Worker for processing objects of a certain type that are posted to the worker exclusively. (Method and fitting port of the worker are added to a CCR ExclusiveReceiverGroup.) MessageTransferMode is "Sequential" by default.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoExclusiveAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new XcoExclusiveAttribute.

member.name: T:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoTeardownAttribute
member.summary: Marks a Method of a Worker for processing objects of a certain type that are posted to the worker. As soon as an object is processed by this method, all CCR ReceiverTasks that are bound to the worker's PortSet are shut down. (Method and fitting port of the worker are added to a CCR TeardownReceiverGroup.) MessageTransferMode is "Parallel" by default.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoTeardownAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new XcoTeardownAttribute.

member.name: T:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoWorkerExtensionAttribute
member.summary: Marks a class as worker extension. When creating a worker, all methods of a worker extension class that are marked with XcoConcurrent, XcoExclusive or XcoTeardown are also taken into account as message processing methods.

member.summary: Creates a new XcoWorkerExtensionAttribute.

member.summary: Checks if the given type is required, meaning if a Port{Type} must exist at the worker for this type.
member.returns: True if the type is required.

member.name: P:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoWorkerExtensionAttribute.Required
member.summary: The list of required types (only either the required types or the optional types should be set). For all types in this list the worker must have a port in its contract (an exception will be thrown during instantiation of the worker when a port with one of these types is missing).

member.name: P:XcoAppSpaces.Core.XcoWorkerExtensionAttribute.Optional
member.summary: The list of optional types (only either the required types or the optional types should be set). For these types the worker does not require to have a port, but the port will be used by the worker extension if it exists.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.Communication.Connector.ConnectWorker``1(System.String,System.String,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to a worker that is running at a remote space. Creates a local proxy of the worker that allows posting messages that are automatically transported to the worker. If the worker does't exist or the connection to the space cannot be established, an XcoCommunicationException is thrown. This method is an alternative to the method taking an URI as address, being more flexible and therefore allowing things like Jabber usernames to be used.
member.typeparam: The contract type of the worker to connect to.
member.param: The address of the worker in den form "address/workername"
The name of the communication service that should be used to communicate with the worker (or null if the default communication service should be used).
The credentials that should be used to connect to the worker.
member.returns: A worker contract instance that allows to post messages to the remote worker.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.Communication.Connector.ConnectWorker``1(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to a worker that is running at a remote space. Creates a local proxy of the worker that allows posting messages that are automatically transported to the worker. If the worker does't exist or the connection to the space cannot be established, an XcoCommunicationException is thrown.
member.typeparam: The contract type of the worker to connect to.
member.param: The address of the space where the worker is running (in form hostname:port).
The name of the communication service that should be used to communicate with the worker (or null if the default communication service should be used).
The credentials that should be used to connect to the worker.
member.returns: A worker contract instance that allows to post messages to the remote worker.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.PortExtensions.Send``1(Microsoft.Ccr.Core.Port{``0},``0)
member.summary: If the port is a remote port, this method sends the given item synchronously, meaning the method only returns as soon as the item has been transferred successfully. This allows directly catching communication errors, and by that ensuring that after this method the item has been transferred correctly. If the port is a local port, the item will simply be posted as normal.
member.typeparam: The message type.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.PortExtensions.SendUnknownType(Microsoft.Ccr.Core.IPort,System.Object)
member.summary: If the port is a remote port, this method sends the given item synchronously, meaning the method only returns as soon as the item has been transferred successfully. This allows directly catching communication errors, and by that ensuring that after this method the item has been transferred correctly. If the port is a local port, the item will simply be posted as normal.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.PortExtensions.SendWithCausality``1(Microsoft.Ccr.Core.Port{``0},``0,Microsoft.Ccr.Core.Port{System.Exception})
member.summary: If the port is a remote port, this method sends the given item synchronously, meaning the method only returns as soon as the item has been transferred successfully. This allows directly catching communication errors, and by that ensuring that after this method the item has been transferred correctly. If the port is a local port, the item will simply be posted as normal. The given exceptionPort is used as causality.
member.typeparam: The message type.
member.param: The port where exceptions should be returned.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.PortExtensions.SendWithCausality``1(Microsoft.Ccr.Core.Port{``0},``0,Microsoft.Ccr.Core.Handler{System.Exception})
member.summary: If the port is a remote port, this method sends the given item synchronously, meaning the method only returns as soon as the item has been transferred successfully. This allows directly catching communication errors, and by that ensuring that after this method the item has been transferred correctly. If the port is a local port, the item will simply be posted as normal. The given exceptionHandler is used to register to a causality for returning exceptions.
member.typeparam: The message type.
member.param: The handler where exceptions should be returned.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.PortSetExtensions.Send``2(Microsoft.Ccr.Core.PortSet{``0,``1},``0)
member.summary: If the port is a remote port, this method sends the given item synchronously, meaning the method only returns as soon as the item has been transferred successfully. This allows directly catching communication errors, and by that ensuring that after this method the item has been transferred correctly. If the port is a local port, the item will simply be posted as normal.
member.typeparam: Message type of the port set.
Message type of the port set.

This allows directly catching communication errors, and by that ensuring that after this method the item has been transferred correctly. If the port is a local port, the item will simply be posted as normal.
member.typeparam: Message type of the port set.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.IXcoAppSpace.ConnectWorker``1(System.String)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to a worker that is running at a remote space, and registers the worker at the local space. After ConnectWorker is called, the worker to which the connection has been established is also available through the appspace's Resolve method. This method allows using addresses that are not displayable with a "hostname:port" pattern.
member.typeparam: The contract type of the worker.
member.param: The address of the worker in form "address/workername"
member.returns: A worker contract instance that allows to post messages to the remote worker.

member.name: M:XcoAppSpaces.Core.IXcoAppSpace.ConnectWorker``1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to a worker that is running at a remote space, and registers the worker at the local space. After ConnectWorker is called, the worker to which the connection has been established is also available through the appspace's Resolve method. This method allows using addresses that are not displayable with a "hostname:port" pattern.
member.typeparam: The contract type of the worker.
member.param: The address of the worker in form "address/workername"
The name under which the worker should be registered locally.
